thread.title: 20 Rihanna Covers That Slayed Your Entire Existence
thread.title_full: 20 Rihanna Covers That Slayed Your Entire Existence

author: Rhonda Elnaggar
title: 20 Rihanna Covers That Slayed Your Entire Existence
text:
View this image ›
Michael Thompson for GQ British ID: 10491808 2. This Rolling Stone cover where her curves and curls were absolutely flourishing. View this image ›
Mark Seliger for Rolling Stone Rihanna circa 2011.
ID: 10492198 3. Or that time when she graced the cover of Vogue for the first time in 2011, wearing this amazing Chanel gown. View this image ›
Annie Leibovitz for Vogue Magazine ID: 10491815 4. Then when she casually broke the internet with this one in 2012. View this image ›
Mario Sorrenti for GQ Magazine But breaking the internet is like an every other week thing for her so…yeah.
ID: 10491617 5. When she posed for Vogue AGAIN and her eyes basically pierced through our souls as she rocked this gorgeous red strapless dress. View this image ›
Annie Leibovitz for Vogue ID: 10492319 6. This cover story for British GQ in 2012 where she continued to give us all life with her red hair. View this image ›
Simon Emmett for GQ Magazine ID: 10491804 7. And when she doubled as Medusa in 2013. View this image ›
Damien Hirst for GQ Magazine ID: 10491816 8. Or that cover she did for Elle UK where she looked absolutely timeless. View this image ›
Mariano Vivanco for Elle UK I remember wanting to cut my hair very short at this point.
ID: 10491781 9. This sultry Rolling Stone cover, also shot in 2013. View this image ›
Terry Richardson for Rolling Stone ID: 10491813 10. Or when she served several incredible looks for a series of covers for Complex Magazine , representing each album that she had given us so far. View this image ›
Zoe McConnell for Complex Magazine And every single one was flawless.
ID: 10492161 11. And we cannot forget one of her most notorious covers that she did for LUI , giving all of us heart palpitations in 2014. View this image ›
Mario Sorrenti for Lui Magazine ID: 10491647 12. Then her Vogue Brazil cover from the same year that left us all speechless. View this image ›
Mariano Vivanco for Vogue Brazil COME THROUGH AMAZING PIXIE CUT COME ON.
ID: 10492508 13. And that time she did that steamy shoot for Esquire that made us all want to get to our nearest gym in December 2014. View this image ›
Ellen Von Unwerth for Esquire Just in time for the holidays.
ID: 10491789 14. Then when she came swinging into 2015 with this insanely beautiful cover for i-D Magazine . View this image ›
Paolo Roversi for i-D Magazine ID: 10491503 15. And as we stepped into summer 2015 — this iconic cover for V Magazine came out, where she rocked this platinum blonde wig, serving us all ’70s styles and grace. View this image ›
Steven Klein for V Magazine ID: 10492072 16. Then when she did this cover for T magazine’s 25 Greats issue in 2015, and even with this simple, clean look, she was still absolutely stunning. View this image ›
Craig McDean for T Magazine Effortless.
ID: 10492044 17. Or this cover she did for The FADER ’s special 100th issue that year, when she added photographer to her résumé. View this image ›
Rihanna for The FADER Again, she’s just the GOAT.
ID: 10491953 18. Her Vogue cover last year, which was also pretty damn jaw-dropping. View this image ›
Mert Alas for Vogue Is there anything she can’t do? I would say no. No there isn’t.
ID: 10491842 19. And that time when she posed as “The Last Woman On Earth” for W Magazine in their September 2016 issue. View this image ›
Steve Klein for W Magazine She’s all we need anyway. Arguably.
ID: 10491847 20. Then finally her most recent: when she did an amazing photoshoot with Harper’s Bazaar . View this image ›
Mariano Vivanco / Via Harper’s Bazaar And as usual, she killed it.
ID: 10491491 Given her track record — this is really nothing out of the ordinary for Rihanna. And we’re just here for all of it. View this image ›
@Zacposen / Via instagram.com Slay on, queen.
ID: 10492518 Rihanna
